New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers extended their undefeated streak to 14 games in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 37 points, a season-high, to lead the Cavaliers to a 144-126 win over the Chicago Bulls.
The Cavaliers pulled away in the second half with a decisive 21-7 run to seal the victory.
Darius Garland scored 29 points and nine assists, Jarrett Allen had a double-double with 24 points and 10 rebounds, and Caris LeVert added 22 points off the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers' win was a historic one, extending their undefeated streak to 14 games.
Donovan Mitchell's 37 points were a season-high for him.
Others: The Chicago Bulls' Coby White scored 29 points, but it was not enough to stop the Cavaliers' winning streak.
